page.title: 17Local Government
page.content: Most of the D block is in{South {Yorkshire}with a small section in {Nottinghamshire.}The County of South Yorkshire,formed in 1974,is under threat of abolition in 1985 and will be replaced by Borough councils.{Woodsetts Parish Council meets once a month under normal circumstances,and these meetings are open to the electors.There are 9 councillors,including one Borough councillor who is also elected as a Parish councillor.There is an open invitation to all three{Rotherham {Borough}councillors in our waid ,and the one county councillor,to attend all our meetings.the meetings are held in the pavilion on the recreation ground in Woodsetts.
